title: European Green Deal: 'A new investment plan to the tune of €180 billion between 2024 and 2030 is needed'
description: In a 'Le Monde' op-ed, economists Jean Pisani-Ferry, Simone Tagliapietra, and Georg Zachmann endorse a new EU green investment plan for carbon neutrality, possibly involving joint borrowing.

title: NATO deploys 600 British soldiers to reinforce presence in Kosovo
description: The US and EU voiced concern earlier this week over Serbia's heightened military deployment near its former province, urging Belgrade to reduce troop presence.

title: Rugby World Cup: South Africa dominate Tonga 49-18
description: The win places the Springboks at the Pool B lead, just one point ahead of Ireland. The outcome of Ireland's match against Scotland next weekend will determine the two teams advancing to the quarterfinals.

title: At least 10 Cuban migrants killed in truck accident in Mexico
description: The incident is the latest in a series of migrant deaths in Mexico amid a surge in migrants traveling toward the US border.

title: Rugby World Cup: Australia beats Portugal to keep knockout stages alive
description: Australia smothered a ferocious comeback by Portugal to win their gripping first matchup 34-14 on Sunday in Saint-Etienne.

title: Russia uses lies as weapons of mass destruction
description: Since the invasion of Ukraine, state lies in Russia have reached an unprecedented level. Russian President Vladimir Putin has a long tradition of distorting reality and disregarding facts. A totalitarian heritage from the Soviet era, the practice is spreading throughout Russian society.

title: Europe regains Ryder Cup despite blistering USA rally
description: Tommy Fleetwood sealed the deal for Europe in Rome on Sunday, taking an unbeatable lead over America in the 44th edition of the biennial golf championship.

title: Polish opposition rally draws 'a million'  protesters to Warsaw
description: Opposition leader Donald Tusk said Sunday's march was 'the biggest demonstration in Warsaw's history.'

title: After Nagorno-Karabakh, Armenia fears it could be next
description: Many Armenians are afraid that Azerbaijan will use its victory to conquer even more territory. For the moment, this threat is tempering criticism of Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan, who has been accused of sacrificing Nagorno-Karabakh.

title: Turkish explosion: Suicide bomber detonates device in Ankara
description: A second assailant was killed in a shootout with police, the interior minister reported.

title: Museums are increasingly concerned about their visitors' psychological well-being
description: At the Palais de Tokyo and the Louvre in Paris, the MoCo in Montpellier and the Louvre-Lens, a growing number of cultural venues are experimenting with new ways of welcoming visitors with mental health problems.

title: US Democrats struggle to control spike in homelessness in western states
description: Extreme temperatures have cast a light on the growing numbers of homeless people in America's major western cities. Government officials are under intense pressure to stackle the housing shortage, which is particularly acute in the West, but also affects the entire country.

title: Dianne Feinstein, the 'Lioness of the US Senate,' has died
description: This historic figure of the Democratic Party and dean of the US Senate died on Thursday, at the age of 90. In 1978, she became the first woman to become mayor of San Francisco, before serving as a California senator for over 30 years.

title: US Congress averts shutdown, aid to Ukraine potential collateral damage
description: An emergency 45-day funding measure for the administration passed in the House of Representatives and then the Senate late on Saturday,  hours before the deadline.

title: The rise of resimercial design in the workplace
description: Companies are trying to make their workspaces more welcoming and cozy to bring their teams back to in-person work.

title: France expands public workforce for climate transition initiatives
description: After years of staffing cuts in the environment and energy ministries, new jobs have been created to support building renovation, the biodiversity strategy and the implementation of the water plan.

title: 'Evergrande isn't the only Chinese property developer to end up in hell'
description: The Shenzhen-based indebted giant's Hong Kong stock listing halted after its CEO's arrest. It's another casualty of the government's credit crunch targeting overambitious property tycoons, according to Le Monde's economic columnist, Philippe Escande.

title: Ilya Yashin, Russian opposition: 'The real Russia is not fighting Ukrainians on the front line. The real Russia is in prison'
description: The opposition politician, sentenced to eight and a half years in a penal colony for criticizing Russian aggression in Ukraine, texted a forum organized by Russie-Libertés in Paris on September 29-30. 'Le Monde' shares key excerpts.
